pullRequest.title: Issue 4977: Add Actions CI for Gradle, Codecov, Java 11
pullRequest.bodyText:
Change log description
Adds build and test/coverage for Java 11. Runs Rat, Checkstyle and SpotBugs before tests.
Purpose of the change
To test the Gradle build against Java 11. To more reliably upload coverage reports to Codecov. To transition off of Travis CI. To run source checks prior to tests.
Fixes #4977
What the code does
Adds a workflow to run compilation against a matrix of Java versions (currently only 11) and tests against a single Java version (11) on a simulated merge.
How to verify it
Actions CI is running in this PR. It also runs in my fork here: derekm#4
Open questions

Should this incorporate release or system test stages from the Travis build?

afterCommit.message:
add Actions CI for Gradle, Codecov, DCO, Java 8/11

Signed-off-by: Derek Moore <derek.moore@dell.com>

separate build & test jobs, enable matrix in build job

Signed-off-by: Derek Moore <derek.moore@dell.com>

nodes.bodyText:
If we want this to be fast and not run integration tests, just add the argument:
--exclude-task test:integration:test
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,69 @@
+# This workflow will build a Java project with Gradle
+# For more information see: https://help.github.com/actions/language-and-framework-guides/building-and-testing-java-with-gradle
+
+name: build
+
+on:
+  push:
+    branches: [ master ]
+  pull_request:
+    branches: [ master ]
+
+jobs:
+  build:
+
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    strategy:
+      matrix:
+        java: [8, 11, 14]
+
+    name: Java ${{ matrix.java }}
+    steps:
+    - uses: actions/checkout@v1
+    - name: Restore local Gradle & Maven cache
+      uses: actions/cache@v2.1.0
+      with:
+        path: |
+          .gradle
+          ~/.gradle
+          ~/.m2
+        key: gradle-m2-java-${{ matrix.java }}
+        restore-keys: |
+          gradle-m2-java-
+          gradle-m2
+    - name: Set up JDK ${{ matrix.java }}
+      uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+      with:
+        java-version: ${{ matrix.java }}
+    - name: Assemble with Gradle
+      run: ./gradlew assemble
+    - name: Javadoc with Gradle
+      run: ./gradlew javadocs
+
+  test:
+
+    needs: build
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+
+    name: Test on Java 8
+    steps:
+    - uses: actions/checkout@v1
+    - name: Restore local Gradle & Maven cache
+      uses: actions/cache@v2.1.0
+      with:
+        path: |
+          .gradle
+          ~/.gradle
+          ~/.m2
+        key: gradle-m2-java-8
+        restore-keys: |
+          gradle-m2-java-
+          gradle-m2
+    - name: Set up JDK 8
+      uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+      with:
+        java-version: 8
+    - name: Check with Gradle
+      run: ./gradlew check

nodes.bodyText: we could use ./gradlew assemble --parallel. This reduced the time taken by this gradle task in my dev box.

+# This workflow will build a Java project with Gradle
+# For more information see: https://help.github.com/actions/language-and-framework-guides/building-and-testing-java-with-gradle
+
+name: build
+
+on:
+  push:
+    branches: [ master ]
+  pull_request:
+    branches: [ master ]
+
+jobs:
+  build:
+
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    strategy:
+      matrix:
+        java: [11]
+
+    name: Java ${{ matrix.java }}
+    steps:
+    - uses: actions/checkout@v1
+    - name: Restore local Gradle & Maven cache
+      uses: actions/cache@v2.1.0
+      with:
+        path: |
+          .gradle
+          ~/.gradle
+          ~/.m2
+        key: gradle-m2-java-${{ matrix.java }}
+        restore-keys: |
+          gradle-m2-java-
+          gradle-m2
+    - name: Set up JDK ${{ matrix.java }}
+      uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+      with:
+        java-version: ${{ matrix.java }}
+    - name: Assemble with Gradle
+      run: ./gradlew assemble
+    - name: Javadoc with Gradle
+      run: ./gradlew javadocs
+    - name: Rat, Checkstyle & Spotbugs with Gradle
+      run: ./gradlew rat checkstyleMain checkstyleTest spotbugsMain spotbugsTest

add Actions CI for Gradle, Codecov & Java 8
